creator: orlanr@objectconsulting.com.au
text:
Using JMeter with a Thread Group with more than one thread causes about 4% of 
HTTP Requests to receive the wrong response. That is, one request receives a 
response that should have been returned to another request.

For example, page1.jsp is requested by one thread at the same time as page2.jsp 
is requested by another, and page1.jsp is returned to both HTTP requests.

The HTTP requests were being made to a WebSphere Commerce Server application, 
running on WebSphere Application Server 4.0.3 on Solaris 9.0, via an iPlanet 
Web Server (Enterprise Edition 6.0). The JMeter Thread Group was using a HTTP 
Cookie Manager to store a cookie with a JSESSIONID to maintain session state 
for the application.

This same problem was found when running JMeter on two seperate machines with 
just one thread each. And again when running one JMeter thread on one machine 
and a Web Browser (Internet Explorer 5.0) on another machine. However, this 
could not be repeated via browser only testing, even with multiple concurrent 
browser requests.

creator: mstover1@apache.org
text:
I can't make this happen.  How are you verifying whether the correct response
was recieved from the right request?

creator: orlanr@objectconsulting.com.au
text:
I was verifying the correct response using some simple Response Assertions, and 
double checkng with manual inspection. It was clear that the requests and 
responses were mismatched some of the time (as mentioned about 4% of the time).

Can't verify this - it works fine for me.  Have you tried it on the latest
JMeter code?  Can you recreate this effect on any other server other than the
one you describe?
creator: mstover1@apache.org

text:
Marking as fixed since I can't reproduce it.  If any more information becomes
available, don't hesitate to reopen.
creator: mstover1@apache.org
